Thank you for the example!

The docs say that setting batch_first=True means that the first dim of input is the batch, ie, input has size (batch, seq_len, num_features). h0 however is unchanged, so the following should work:

rnn = nn.RNN(10, 20, 2, batch_first=True)
input = Variable(torch.randn(5, 3, 10).transpose(0, 1))
h0 = Variable(torch.randn(2, 3, 20))
output, hn = rnn(input, h0)
output.size(), hn.size()

I do agree the error message could be better, though

body:
Thank you for the example!

The [docs](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html?highlight=rnn#torch.nn.RNN) say that setting `batch_first=True` means that the first dim of input is the batch, ie, input has size `(batch, seq_len, num_features)`. `h0` however is unchanged, so the following should work:

```
rnn = nn.RNN(10, 20, 2, batch_first=True)
input = Variable(torch.randn(5, 3, 10).transpose(0, 1))
h0 = Variable(torch.randn(2, 3, 20))
output, hn = rnn(input, h0)
output.size(), hn.size()
```

I do agree the error message could be better, though
